## ğŸ“‹ Issue Description

Multiple `__pycache__/` folders with `.pyc` files exist throughout the project. These are:
- Automatically generated by Python
- Should be ignored by git
- Taking up space
- Can cause confusion

## ğŸ” Current State

```bash
# Found cache folders
basics/07_file_handling/__pycache__/  (25+ .pyc files)
# ... more folders
```

## âœ… Tasks

- [ ] Find all `__pycache__/` folders
  ```bash
  find . -name "__pycache__" -type d
  ```

- [ ] Find all `.pyc` files
  ```bash
  find . -name "*.pyc"
  ```

- [ ] Remove all cache files
  ```bash
  find . -name "__pycache__" -exec rm -rf {} +
  find . -name "*.pyc" -delete
  ```

- [ ] Verify `.gitignore` has these entries:
  ```gitignore
  __pycache__/
  *.py[cod]
  *$py.class
  ```

- [ ] Add `.gitignore` rule if missing

## âš ï¸ Risk Assessment

**No Risk:**
- Cache files are auto-generated
- Will be recreated when needed
- No source code affected

## ğŸ¯ Why This Matters

- **Clean repo**: No unnecessary files
- **Smaller size**: Less disk space
- **Best practice**: Cache should not be committed
- **CI/CD**: Faster deployments

## ğŸ“ Difficulty

**Beginner** - Simple cleanup task
